Articles.Content:
I notice that the Wolfhound engine's thrust-vector is NOT aligned to a spacecraft's fore-to-aft centerline. Even if you just spawn one by itself in the VAB, this happens.

(torque data courtesy of RCS Build Aid)

Is this intentional? I can't seem to get this engine to propel any spacecraft without it causing severe tumbling

Glad I'm not the only one who noticed this.  But I have to say I built quite a few before one flipped on me.  It was on one that had a heavier topend than the others, which makes some sense.

Edited April 29, 2018 by Oblivion4
additional thought
I use the wolfhound a lot for interplanetary missions and have not encountered any major problems. Though it can be annoying when you have a low level pilot without SAS hold options.
